page.title: 05A MORNING IN LOSSIEMOUTH
page.content: "Wakey Wakey", my mum shouts. I don't want to get up. Reluctantly I go downstairs and start putting on my clothes. My sister looks as if she's still asleep. A hot roll and a drink does me fine for my breakfast. I put my playpiece in my schoolbag and wait for my grandad to come and take us to school. It pleases him to do this ( I think ). As I arrive at school the bell rings. Everyone rushes to their lines, well, to tell the truth it's more like a slow plod. We work until ten to one with a playtime in between. I run all the way home because I am starving. Well, dinner over and back to school to do more gruelling work.
